FollowUpSaved.synopsis: Jaheira and Isobel (and the player) reunite after the fight with Marcus. Jaheira is relieved Isobel hasn't been captured. Isobel debriefs with player and sends them off on their main mission for Act 2. Both of them will be in heightened mood, having just survived a fierce battle- not totally out of breath, but still recovering from the immediate battle.
FollowUpSaved.how_to_trigger: Trigger Marcus' kidnapping scene in Act 2 by talking to Isobel without having first killed Marcus. Killcombat, then wait for Jaheira to find Isobel.

JaheiraCallToArm.synopsis: Isobel is being attacked. Jaheira calls people to defend Isobel, as their lives depend on her.This dialog can happen anywhere in Last Light, but mainly close to Isobel's room.
JaheiraCallToArm.how_to_trigger: if the player attacks Isobel and Jaheira enters the same combat, Jaheira does this dialog on her turn. Only in HAV.

PAD_SpyTransformationClue.synopsis: If we go up on the roof above Isobel’s room, we’ll find discarded FF armour and some bloodstains from a transformation of some kind. A successful med check shows someone burst out of their armour (Marcus)

BriefInRoom.synopsis: Isobel is in her room re-casting the spell that is protecting the inn. After she spots you, she gives you information about Ketheric and a spell to protect you from the shadowcurse.After Isobel gives this information, she is interrupted by the Absolute-tadpoled Flaming Fist, who attempts to kidnap her.
BriefInRoom.how_to_trigger: Isobel came back to her room after the lake scene,and the player doesn't know about Ketheric wanting Isobel at Moonrise yet.

FlamingSpy_Dead.synopsis: SwD for the Flaming Fist Spy Marcus. Which questions is relevant may vary depending on the moment he dies (before the capture happens, during the capture or in Moonrise).

SpyCapture.synopsis: Marcus, the Flaming Spy, attempts to abduct Isobel.The dialogue either  immediately follows HAV_TakingIsobel_BriefInRoom, or starts if Marcus gets into combat after reaching Isobel's room.In the former case, the player is given the option to side with Isobel or Marcus.In the latter, Marcus defaults to being hostile to the player. The latter case can also play with a party member who is not of a normally speaking shape.After the ghouls are summoned, Mol is abducted and several Flaming Fists are incapacitated, if they are available.
SpyCapture.how_to_trigger: 1. Load SCL_Main_A2. goto 13 30 1033. Approach the checkpoint4. Press 1 until the dialogue ends (some ~12 times)5. Continue up to Isobel's room (-63; 33; 162)6. Wait for Marcus to address you.7. Use the 'attack' button.8. Pass the turn to him.OR:1. Load SCL_Main_A2. goto 13 30 1033. Approach the checkpoint4. Press 1 until the dialogue ends (some ~12 times)5. Continue up to Isobel's room (-63; 33; 162)6. Wait for Marcus to address you.7. Go through the dialogue without making him hostile.8. Talk to Isobel.9. Continue through her dialogue by pressing 1 until it ends.OR1. Rescue the Tieflings in act 1 (use debug book option)2. Load SCL_Main_A3. goto 13 30 1034. Approach the checkpoint5. Press 1 until the dialogue ends (some ~12 times)6. Continue up to Isobel's room (-63; 33; 162)7. Go through the dialogue without making him hostile.8. Talk to Isobel.9. Continue through her dialogue by pressing 1 until it ends.

Jaheira_AD_ToIsobel.synopsis: Jaheira is trying to get to Isobel after the area has been attacked by winged ghouls.

AD_FollowUp.synopsis: |After the ghoul attack (aka inn attack) Jaheira does this AD to catch the player's attention, while walking to them to talk to them. Player is in there not to speak but to allow tag and flag checks|

AD_SpyRemindsKO.synopsis: Player sided with Marcus against Isobel. He will remind the player not to kill her during combat.

IsobelSaved.synopsis: Once the Flaming Fist has been defeated, a shaken Isobel urges players who helped her to go and assist with the fight in the main room. She is coughing and unwell.

FlamingSpy.synopsis: Default dialog of Marcus, the tadpoled Flaming Fist spy tasked by Ketheric with abducting Isobel. Marcus is outside Isobel's room when this dialog plays and he tries to convince the player to join him in kidnapping isobel. Can lead to combat or alliance.
FlamingSpy.how_to_trigger: After the checkpoint, the FlamingSpy is in Isobel's room. Player can talk to him before the dialog HAV_DefeatingKetheric_BriefAtLake is triggered.

AD_CombatBetrayalReveal.synopsis: Isobel announces player's betral during combat

AD_BeforeFlamingSpy.synopsis: The player clicks on Isobel before her dialogue with the Flaming Fist spy has been resolved, i.e. it wasn't started, or it was started and interrupted.

CoolingDown.synopsis: Isobel has a one-liner in case the player clicks on her while Jaheira is running up to her to do a dual dialog after Marcus' failed attempt at kidnapping Jaheira.

AD_SpyWaiting.synopsis: Fallback AD if the player clicks on the flaming spy while Isobel is unavailable, or he's somehow forced out of Isobel's room while trying to start HAV_TakingIsobel_FlamingSpy.

AD_ReactingToRoofNoise.synopsis: The player is walking on the roof above Isobel's room and VoiceBarking about the Flaming Spy's transformation leftovers. Isobel reacts if she is close enough to hear.

AD_SpyAtEntrance.synopsis: Fallback AD for the flaming fist spy. If he didn't vouch for the player in Entering Haven, he sticks around after the scene, this is to give the chance to the player to notice him. As soon as the player approaches him though, he starts walking away. The player shouldn't normally be able to click on him before he starts moving, but I can't garantee that some frame delay might happen... So this is a vary short AD, a feedback in case the player manages to click on him. He'll say it while turning around and moving away. The player can later talk to him in the dialog HAV_TakingIsobel_FlamingSpy.

FollowUpSaved_152.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_152.context: InternalNodeContext: To IsobelNodeContext: Relieved. If Isobel had been taken, things would be very bad

FollowUpSaved_43.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_43.context: NodeContext: Reassuring - Isobel's survival means the survival of the entire region, so she's saying 'I'm all good, let's worry about more important things'

FollowUpSaved_34.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_34.text: Marcus has been with us since the start - they've been tracking us this whole time.

FollowUpSaved_82.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_82.text: And that was no random attack - you were the target, Isobel. They know how important you are.

FollowUpSaved_102.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_102.text: But they don't know about you.
FollowUpSaved_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerInternalNodeContext: To player

FollowUpSaved_167.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_167.text: Your future is our future. Stop Ketheric, and you may find the cure to that parasite in your head.

FollowUpSaved_108.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_108.text: I haven't agreed to do anything.

FollowUpSaved_68.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_68.text: Our fates are entwined - more than you may realise. Ketheric's cult put that parasite in your head. There's no obscenity too vile for him.

FollowUpSaved_76.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_76.text: General Ketheric Thorm. Remember that name. He's the leader of the Absolutists.

FollowUpSaved_99.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_99.text: He was a Sharran, once - took to building an army of Dark Justiciars beneath this very village. Alongside the local druids, we made it our business to see him deposed - dead and buried.

FollowUpSaved_165.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_165.text: But he's returned. Not only does General Ketheric Thorm live again, it seems he is no longer mortal. He has become, in fact, invincible.

FollowUpSaved_86.speaker: Narrator
FollowUpSaved_86.text: *Ketheric Thorm worshipped Lady Shar...? That would make him your natural ally, surely. Though perhaps it would be unwise to voice such a thought to present company...*

FollowUpSaved_158.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_158.text: We met him on the road here - commanding the army of the Absolute. I put an arrow through his eye myself, only to watch him pluck it out like a splinter.

FollowUpSaved_124.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_124.text: A man does not return from the dead and becomes impervious to arrows out of nowhere. There is magic at work - strong, arcane, and most likely necromantic.

FollowUpSaved_0.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_0.text: He healed right in front of me, and chased us into the shadows. We took shelter here, and were considering a full retreat - until you came along.

FollowUpSaved_116.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_116.text: I don't know why he's waiting, why he's not marching his army west as we speak, but as long as he remains, there's still a chance.

FollowUpSaved_87.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_87.text: You are that chance. Protected by your artefact, you can infiltrate Moonrise Towers, posing as a True Soul.

FollowUpSaved_112.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_112.text: Discover the source of his invulnerability. Make him mortal, so we can make him bleed. Good luck.
FollowUpSaved_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira walks away.InternalNodeContext: directed to playerNodeContext:  directed to player

FollowUpSaved_49.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_49.text: We're in more danger than I knew. If something happens to me, everyone in this inn is dead. Like that.
FollowUpSaved_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snaps her finger on 'that' or does some other gesture of immediacyInternalNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: (GregRetake) too breathless and hopeless, more grim realization

FollowUpSaved_107.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_107.text: Pull the right brick, and the whole tower goes tumbling down.
FollowUpSaved_107.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

FollowUpSaved_51.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_51.text: Selûne gave me the power to protect this place, but I can't keep it up forever. Such magic, it's... draining. Soon I'll be dry.
FollowUpSaved_51.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

FollowUpSaved_85.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_85.text: Without me, Harpers, Flaming Fist, everyone intent on stopping Ketheric is dead.
FollowUpSaved_85.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all needs more determination

FollowUpSaved_48.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_48.text: But now that we have you, perhaps we have a chance.
FollowUpSaved_48.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

FollowUpSaved_41.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_41.text: Marcus told me Ketheric wanted you captured - not killed. Why?

FollowUpSaved_89.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_89.text: Why does a man like him do anything? Power - spite - some kind of twisted, personal morality.
FollowUpSaved_89.context:
CinematicNodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all
NodeContext: She's talking about her father here, though not admitting htat to the player. This is deeply personal to her.

FollowUpSaved_8.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_8.text: I can understand why he'd want me dead. Without me keeping the curse at bay, everyone in this inn - everyone intent on killing him - is dead too.
FollowUpSaved_8.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

FollowUpSaved_26.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_26.text: As for why he'd want to take me alive... I don't know. And I don't want to find out.
FollowUpSaved_26.context: NodeContext: (gregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all was too casual

FollowUpSaved_162.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_162.text: Now that we have you, I hope I won't have to.
FollowUpSaved_162.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

FollowUpSaved_79.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_79.text: Let's hope your cunning is as strong as your optimism.

FollowUpSaved_36.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_36.text: You're the key to all of this.

FollowUpSaved_18.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_18.text: I'm getting tired of hearing that.

FollowUpSaved_118.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_118.text: You'll have time for irrelevance when you're dead. For now, we need you.

FollowUpSaved_58.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_58.text: I never get tired of hearing that.

FollowUpSaved_139.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_139.text: Good. Because your work here is only beginning.

FollowUpSaved_84.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_84.text: Then you'd better find a way to stop a second attack.

FollowUpSaved_145.speaker: Shadowheart
FollowUpSaved_145.text: A Sharran? Perhaps someone I should seek out...

FollowUpSaved_96.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_96.text: I'll look after them, Jaheira. You should check on the others.
FollowUpSaved_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: After this, Jaheira nods at Isobel, then looks at the player meaningfully

FollowUpSaved_163.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_163.text: Remember what we discussed. Ketheric will strike again. We need you to strike first.
FollowUpSaved_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira leaves after lineNodeContext: She needs in affirmation, but has one last thing to say to the players before departing.

FollowUpSaved_101.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_101.text: If you are who I think you are, you have a long road ahead of you. Good luck. And thank you.
FollowUpSaved_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira leaves after lineNodeContext: Jaheira to player

FollowUpSaved_35.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_35.text: I'm Isobel. And you're... meant to save us all, I believe?

FollowUpSaved_131.speaker: Narrator
FollowUpSaved_131.text: *Isobel. The same name as Ketheric Thorm's daughter - the one whose sarcophagus you found empty in the family mausoleum.*

FollowUpSaved_106.speaker: Narrator
FollowUpSaved_106.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

FollowUpSaved_69.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_69.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. But you - you're different.

FollowUpSaved_78.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_78.text: Small inn. And it's not every day someone like you comes waltzing out of the dark.

FollowUpSaved_6.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_6.text: You can walk among the cult unnoticed. You can get close to Ketheric. Sounds to me like you're the answer to our biggest problem.

FollowUpSaved_140.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_140.text: You can walk among the cult unnoticed - which means you can get close to their leader, Ketheric Thorm, in Moonrise Towers.
FollowUpSaved_140.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) was too reverant in awe of the player

FollowUpSaved_31.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_31.text: I'm getting tired of hearing that.

FollowUpSaved_83.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_83.text: I never get tired of hearing that.

FollowUpSaved_155.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_155.text: I have something for you - something that'll help you make it to the Towers.
FollowUpSaved_155.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) too relaxed, she is equipping the player before sending them off to almost certain death

FollowUpSaved_104.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_104.text: Consider it a backup in case you lose that lantern.

FollowUpSaved_45.context:
CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene.

We see every party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

FollowUpSaved_123.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_123.text: It suits you. And better than that, it'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
FollowUpSaved_123.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was too jokey. The magic she uses prior to this is very elegant, almost spiritual

FollowUpSaved_77.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_77.text: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.
FollowUpSaved_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel hands the player the Moon Lantern.

FollowUpSaved_22.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_22.text: A Moonlantern? Those are powered by trapped pixies, you know.

FollowUpSaved_159.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_159.text: We'll be sure to free them - after Ketheric is dead.

FollowUpSaved_3.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_3.text: Thank you - now I must make my way to the Towers.

FollowUpSaved_81.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_81.text: Wait - before you head off into the shadows, there's... something else.
FollowUpSaved_81.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) Too nervous and tentative. The wait sounds like shes panicked.

FollowUpSaved_160.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_160.text: I don't like to go on in front of the others, but... it's about Ketheric Thorm.

FollowUpSaved_67.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_67.text: He used to preside over this village - a good man, a respected man - who turned to darkness quite suddenly, I've been told.

FollowUpSaved_5.speaker: Narrator
FollowUpSaved_5.text: *There's an acute sadness in her voice. It seems she's even more invested in this story than she'd like to admit.*

FollowUpSaved_44.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_44.text: He began worshipping Shar and raised an army of Dark Justiciars right underneath the locals' noses. A coalition of Harpers and druids put him down - killed him and buried him in the Thorm family mausoleum.

FollowUpSaved_21.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_21.text: But now... he's returned. And he's invincible. Neither arrow nor sword can harm him.

FollowUpSaved_146.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_146.text: The darkness he's subscribed to is unlike any I've heard of. I fear there's something deeper behind it all - something neither you, nor I, nor even Selûne can fix.

FollowUpSaved_138.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_138.text: I found this on the wall when I arrived. It must be a hundred years old. Ketheric, before he turned.
FollowUpSaved_138.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She shows us an old daguerrotype photo of two individuals: Ketheric Thorm and Aylin (Nightsong). They stand side-by-side in a somewhat austere way, rather than affectionate. Still, each has kindness in their face. Isobel was the (magical) 
photographer.

FollowUpSaved_29.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_29.text: This man - a Selûnite, not unlike myself - had family. Friends. And he abandoned them all to become a monster.

FollowUpSaved_66.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_66.text: I know Jaheira narrowly escaped his grasp. Have you encountered him yet?

FollowUpSaved_91.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_91.text: I've seen him - he was presiding over a trial. Survived what should've been a lethal blow, too.

FollowUpSaved_39.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_39.text: Him presiding over a court of law. What a joke. I'm glad you got out of there alive - that's more than many can say.

FollowUpSaved_130.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_130.text: I haven't met him yet - but I intend to.

FollowUpSaved_12.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_12.text: Brave fellow. They say there's no fanaticism like that of a convert, and Ketheric is a convert many times over.

FollowUpSaved_50.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_50.text: He is fickle. Changeable. His devotion is shallow but violent.

FollowUpSaved_105.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_105.text: I don't fear much. Not even death. But I do fear him.

FollowUpSaved_33.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_33.text: I've seen him in a kind of vision.

FollowUpSaved_134.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_134.text: You did? How did he... how did he seem?

FollowUpSaved_122.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_122.text: So powerful he may be past our ability to fix this.

FollowUpSaved_16.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_16.text: To turn away from Selûne for this. This curse. This disgusting power to corrupt and kill...
FollowUpSaved_16.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was on the verge of tears, try for more disgust as to what her father has done

FollowUpSaved_80.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_80.text: We need a champion to find the source of his invincibility and put it to an end. And it seems, my not-quite-True-Soul, that champion is you.

FollowUpSaved_20.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_20.text: I still don't see why it has to be me.

FollowUpSaved_7.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_7.text: Why you? It's like the gods custom-designed you to sabotage this cult - to put an end to Ketheric Thorm.
FollowUpSaved_7.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was too dramatic too fangirly, doesnt match with following line

FollowUpSaved_157.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_157.text: You can walk among the cultists undetected; you can find the source of Ketheric's power.
FollowUpSaved_157.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) too reverant and in awe of the player doesnt match with previous

FollowUpSaved_109.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_109.text: Somehow fate keeps leading me to the same conclusion.

FollowUpSaved_133.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_133.text: Perhaps there's something to it, then.
FollowUpSaved_133.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) next line is "No mercy." pretty odd tone shift

FollowUpSaved_103.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_103.text: You'll be here to protect these people, won't you?

FollowUpSaved_94.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_94.text: For as long as I'm able. Even Selûne's light can't hold back the dark forever.

FollowUpSaved_10.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_10.text: Once I take Ketheric's head, you'll be safe again.

FollowUpSaved_169.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_169.text: No mercy. For Ketheric will have none on you. End this.
FollowUpSaved_169.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) line is preceded by several lines, first record had a major shift in tone. Treat "no mercy" as advice not a command.

FollowUpSaved_164.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_164.text: I've been over this with Jaheira. I'll head to the Towers shortly.

FollowUpSaved_136.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_136.text: Not yet. Jaheira says he's invincible - that I need to find a way to make him vulnerable.

FollowUpSaved_1.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_1.text: Whatever he's done to protect himself is a magic so dark I can hardly fathom it.

FollowUpSaved_100.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_100.text: Who's the woman in the picture?

FollowUpSaved_55.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_55.text: Everything Ketheric has touched for a hundred years has died - quickly, by violence, or slowly, by decay.

FollowUpSaved_62.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_62.text: Anything else I should know before heading off?

FollowUpSaved_23.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_23.text: Ketheric is a frightening man. But you have something he doesn't: allies worth having.

FollowUpSaved_25.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_25.text: I'm not sure if I can trust a Selûnite.

FollowUpSaved_72.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_72.text: I'd say the same about you, if I hadn't just seen you fight against Marcus. I'm willing to put my doubts aside - perhaps you can, too.
FollowUpSaved_72.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) tone it down a bit, starts off a little valley girl

FollowUpSaved_97.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_97.text: Marcus told me Ketheric wanted you captured - not killed. Why?

FollowUpSaved_70.speaker: Shadowheart
FollowUpSaved_70.text: Selûnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
FollowUpSaved_70.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Low-key revulsion

FollowUpSaved_149.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_149.text: I might take that badly if you hadn't just saved my neck, Sharran.

FollowUpSaved_114.speaker: Shadowheart
FollowUpSaved_114.text: A gaudy display. Let's just hope it actually protects us.
FollowUpSaved_114.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has NOT been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Distaste (while keeping her cards to her chest re: her shar worship)

FollowUpSaved_98.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_98.text: Only a fool would doubt the Moonmaiden.
FollowUpSaved_98.context: NodeContext: Pointed. Directed at Shadowheart for making an anti-Selune statement.

FollowUpSaved_142.speaker: Player
FollowUpSaved_142.text: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.

FollowUpSaved_75.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_75.text: Well! If I'd have realised, I'd have spared the theatrics. In that case, you should be able to navigate a path straight to your target. That's good - very good.

FollowUpSaved_132.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_132.text: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.

FollowUpSaved_119.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_119.text: The True Soul who saved my life.

FollowUpSaved_148.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved_148.text: We've met. They warned me about Marcus - just before the attack.

FollowUpSaved_71.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_71.text: You were right. You tried to warn me, but I was too stubborn to listen. It won't happen again.

FollowUpSaved_42.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_42.text: It was exactly as you reported. I can't believe I didn't see it sooner.

FollowUpSaved_28.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_28.text: Now more than ever, you're our best hope of making it out of here alive.

FollowUpSaved_127.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_127.text: Ketheric will strike again. We need you to strike first.

FollowUpSaved_37.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_37.text: We need you to infiltrate Moonrise Towers - no one will suspect a 'True Soul'. Ketheric's been made immortal.

FollowUpSaved_59.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_59.text: He can be unmade, but we need you to find out the source of his invulnerability.

FollowUpSaved_63.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved_63.text: Make him mortal, so we can make him bleed.

JaheiraCallToArm_0.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraCallToArm_0.text: To arms! Protect Isobel at all cost!
JaheiraCallToArm_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus should be on the shoulders up to obscure whether or not Jaheira has a weapon in hand (cannot be guaranteed).NodeContext: Shouted during the onset of battle

JaheiraCallToArm_1.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraCallToArm_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus should be on the shoulders up to obscure whether or not Jaheira has a weapon in hand (cannot be guaranteed).NodeContext: Shouted during the onset of battle

PAD_SpyTransformationClue_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SpyTransformationClue_0.text: Someone - something - shed Flaming Fist armour like a second skin.

PAD_SpyTransformationClue_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SpyTransformationClue_1.text: Blood and bits of armour. Worrying.

BriefInRoom_146.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_146.text: *Your tingling Urge knows her face - this is the cleric Sceleritas sent you to kill.*

BriefInRoom_222.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_222.text: He was trying to kidnap you. I sensed the tadpole in his head.

BriefInRoom_131.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_131.text: He was trying to kidnap you. When he died, a tadpole came out of his head.

BriefInRoom_206.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_206.text: A tadpole? Maiden's milk - how could that be?
BriefInRoom_206.context: NodeContext: Incredulous and angry at herself.

BriefInRoom_195.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_195.text: I have no reason to lie. Marcus was a danger to you all.

BriefInRoom_3.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_3.text: If that were true, why wait to make his move? He'd had every opportunity.

BriefInRoom_2.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_2.text: What I see is an ally dead, and a stranger standing over his corpse.
BriefInRoom_2.context: NodeContext: Growing icy. About to attack.

BriefInRoom_271.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_271.text: Believe it. He slipped through your fingers, but not mine.

BriefInRoom_164.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_164.text: In that case, I owe you a debt of gratitude.

BriefInRoom_127.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_127.text: He crowed about what fools you all were to trust him.

BriefInRoom_15.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_15.text: If that's true, then he was right.

BriefInRoom_48.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_48.text: You're the True Soul from the gate, right? It's a good thing you were here. I'm Isobel. And we have much to discuss.

BriefInRoom_103.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_103.text: I may be a True Soul, but I'm not like Marcus. The parasite doesn't control me.

BriefInRoom_108.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_108.text: If I didn't believe it before, I certainly do now.
BriefInRoom_108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nods in the direction of Marcus' corpse

BriefInRoom_225.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_225.text: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.

BriefInRoom_39.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_39.text: I've heard of you. You're protecting this inn - just not from Marcus.

BriefInRoom_113.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_113.text: When you don't have eyes in the back of your head, it helps to have allies. Allies like you.

BriefInRoom_142.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_142.text: Your trip to the Towers, for one. And what you plan to do there. A True Soul with a mind of their own...

BriefInRoom_106.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_106.text: Well. I won't make that mistake twice.

BriefInRoom_66.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_66.text: I just did you a favour. Marcus was a traitor.

BriefInRoom_170.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_170.text: Now that you mention it... he was here before Jaheira caught that tadpole she's been using.

BriefInRoom_135.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_135.text: But... no. There was no opportunity - no chance for him to become infected.

BriefInRoom_5.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_5.text: I'm hungry for blood. And I want yours next.

BriefInRoom_190.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_190.text: Nice of you to show your colours, True Soul. Jaheira will be so disappointed she trusted you.

BriefInRoom_155.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_155.text: I don't mind, though. I've been itching to gut a traitor. Ketheric's out of reach, but here you are, right within striking distance.
BriefInRoom_155.context: NodeContext: With searing hatred, about ot attack player.

BriefInRoom_189.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing for battle with evil player.NodeContext: Right before battle.

BriefInRoom_239.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_239.text: I will flay your skin and hang it over the balcony!

BriefInRoom_117.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_117.text: I just did you a favour. Marcus wished to betray you. And there are other dark forces after you.

BriefInRoom_125.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_125.text: Dark forces upon dark forces, so it seems.

BriefInRoom_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is standing on the balcony, bathed in a beam of moonlight piercing the darkness. Her hands are in a prayer position and she's chanting softly as the moonlight dances around her. She exhales, then inhales and breaths in tendrils of shadow, absorbing them. She swallows, then begins hacking coughing. The moonlight dissipates. She quickly goes from seeming like a divine spirit to a normal young woman.

BriefInRoom_53.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_53.text: I didn't realise I had an audience.

BriefInRoom_84.speaker: Fist Marcus
BriefInRoom_84.context: NodeContext: With some warmth, as though they're good acquaintances if not friends

BriefInRoom_166.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_166.text: *Isobel. The same name as Ketheric Thorm's daughter - the one whose sarcophagus you found empty in the family mausoleum.*

BriefInRoom_82.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_82.text: I thought I smelled a Selûnite.

BriefInRoom_254.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_254.text: Let's not let an ancient squabble interfere with the task at hand.

BriefInRoom_279.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_279.text: Not as ancient as you think.

BriefInRoom_94.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_94.text: You can tell my allegiance from a look?

BriefInRoom_186.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_186.text: It's an aura. Or a lack of one, really.

BriefInRoom_207.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_207.text: Frankly, I'm surprised you're willing to help us. Your kind aren't known for their decency - particularly when a Sharran curse is our greatest obstacle.

BriefInRoom_283.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_283.text: But if you are who I think you are, I'd be a fool to reject your help. The True Soul with... well, a soul. Imagine.

BriefInRoom_205.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_205.text: I'm glad you've remembered who needs whose help here.

BriefInRoom_258.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_258.text: Oh - aren't you looking for a protection spell?
BriefInRoom_258.context: NodeContext: Feigning ignorance. She knows the player needs her help, but the player has just finished trying to back her into a corner.

BriefInRoom_64.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_64.text: I am already protected. My Lady shields me from the curse.

BriefInRoom_10.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_10.text: For now, perhaps. But Shar can be fickle, and her love can prove fleeting. Do not turn your back on an advantage you may need... even a Selûnite one.

BriefInRoom_274.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_274.text: If nothing else, it can aid any companions who travel with you - somehow I doubt Shar's largesse was extended to them.

BriefInRoom_97.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_97.text: I need nothing from a Selûnite.

BriefInRoom_270.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_270.text: But any others who travel with you may not agree. Do it for them at least - you will need all the help you can get out there.

BriefInRoom_144.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_144.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
BriefInRoom_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

BriefInRoom_290.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_290.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.

BriefInRoom_141.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

BriefInRoom_136.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_136.text: It was nothing. Put it out of your mind.

BriefInRoom_52.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_52.text: *But was it truly nothing? The pain gripped you tight, robbing you of all composure for a moment...*
BriefInRoom_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

BriefInRoom_241.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_241.text: *Pain bursts from the wound on your hand. You see yourself kneeling in a dark hall, surrounded by initiates. A female voice preaches against Selûne and all she stands for. You nod, rapt.*
BriefInRoom_241.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memoriy fragment

BriefInRoom_109.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

BriefInRoom_85.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_85.text: Well! If the Moonmaiden didn't strike me dead for blessing you, she must rather approve of this little alliance.

BriefInRoom_95.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_95.text: This will block the lesser effects of the shadow curse, allowing you to traverse the darkness outside... should Shar's own protection falter, that is.
BriefInRoom_95.context: NodeContext: Bit of faux concern at the end - taking a dig at a Sharran

BriefInRoom_73.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_73.text: Curious. Surely the Nightsinger could have shielded all her followers, and made this place her domain long ago... yet she only acts now, and aids you alone. I wonder why.

BriefInRoom_192.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_192.text: The Dark Lady's works aren't for me to question.

BriefInRoom_182.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_182.text: Mustn't question the great shadow mother, must we?
BriefInRoom_182.context: NodeContext: bit of sarcasm in her voice, referring to Shar

BriefInRoom_256.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_256.text: I'll stop needling you, though. You have more important things to do, after all.

BriefInRoom_203.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_203.text: I've already been to Moonrise, but I have more work to do indeed.

BriefInRoom_288.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_288.text: I imagine so, if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing off into the night.

BriefInRoom_178.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_178.text: I do, though I already have a Moonlantern.

BriefInRoom_285.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_285.text: That Moonlantern - you know it's powered by trapped pixies, right?

BriefInRoom_89.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_89.text: Anything else I should know before heading off?

BriefInRoom_251.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_251.text: I don't know what to make of it myself.

BriefInRoom_232.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_232.text: I suppose Shar is nothing if not mysterious.

BriefInRoom_104.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_104.text: Nod. Better to humour her than make an enemy of all in this place. Lady Shar will understand.

BriefInRoom_90.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_90.text: Refreshingly pragmatic of you. I sense Shar has offered some amount of protection to you already, but... well, no harm in extra precaution - even from a Selûnite.

BriefInRoom_122.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_122.text: You seem to have a lot to say about my allegiance. Can we focus on the task at hand?

BriefInRoom_92.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_92.text: I suppose that would be wise. We have a common enemy, after all: Ketheric Thorm.

BriefInRoom_81.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_81.text: I may have the parasite of a True Soul, but not the mind of one.

BriefInRoom_210.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_210.text: And that's what makes you essential.

BriefInRoom_242.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_242.text: I won't be spoken to like that by a Selûnite.

BriefInRoom_74.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_74.text: We've both got a bitter pill to swallow. When this is all over, we can spit it back out.

BriefInRoom_278.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_278.text: You'll be needing the protection spell, I presume?

BriefInRoom_91.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_91.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

BriefInRoom_60.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_60.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. I've heard you might be the person to stop him.

BriefInRoom_260.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_260.text: A True Soul with a soul. Imagine.

BriefInRoom_139.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_139.text: This Sharran exposed a traitor in your midst.

BriefInRoom_23.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_23.text: Fair. I admit, Marcus waltzing around the place undetected bodes rather ill for our defences, doesn't it?

BriefInRoom_162.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_162.text: Then again, the best defence is a good offence.

BriefInRoom_165.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_165.text: I want nothing more than to cut you up and eat you raw!

BriefInRoom_268.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_268.text: The True Soul who's going to save us all. Pleased to meet you.
BriefInRoom_268.context: NodeContext: With a twinkle in her eye and a bit of swagger despite the fact htat she's just come off a coughing fit.

BriefInRoom_129.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_129.text: *The Urge deep within tingles. This is the one the Butler commanded you to kill.*

BriefInRoom_277.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_277.text: *You choke down the obscene thoughts racking your body with a shiver.*

BriefInRoom_99.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_99.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

BriefInRoom_118.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_118.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. I've heard you might be the person to stop him.

BriefInRoom_148.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_148.text: Save you? How do you figure that?

BriefInRoom_263.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_263.text: We've been waiting - hoping against hope - for someone like you.

BriefInRoom_229.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_229.text: And you. I've heard you're the protector of this inn - the banisher of shadows.

BriefInRoom_47.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_47.text: Myself and our Lady are doing what we can to hold the line. I hear you and your tadpole will be our offence.

BriefInRoom_173.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_173.text: Free from the Absolute's influence, yet able to walk among cultists.
BriefInRoom_173.context: NodeContext: Lookihng at player intently, impressed, circumspect

BriefInRoom_26.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_26.text: It's almost too good to be true. But I'd be a poor cleric indeed not to avail of a blessing when I see one.

BriefInRoom_59.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_59.text: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.

BriefInRoom_18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene. (lighting tests in progree for clouds revealing the moon)

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

BriefInRoom_37.speaker: Narrator
BriefInRoom_37.text: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*

BriefInRoom_245.speaker: Shadowheart
BriefInRoom_245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

BriefInRoom_120.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_120.text: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.

BriefInRoom_68.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_68.text: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.
BriefInRoom_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel hands the player the Moon Lantern.

BriefInRoom_111.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_111.text: But there are places it won't help - places where the curse is darker. Stronger.

BriefInRoom_174.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_174.text: The cultists are able to traverse even the deepest shadows, though. I don't know how - the Harpers are trying to figure it out.

BriefInRoom_177.speaker: Shadowheart
BriefInRoom_177.text: Selûnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
BriefInRoom_177.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Low-key revulsion

BriefInRoom_252.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_252.text: Good nose. Like a nasty little terrier.

BriefInRoom_133.speaker: Shadowheart
BriefInRoom_133.text: A gaudy display. Let's just hope it actually protects us.
BriefInRoom_133.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has NOT been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Distaste (while keeping her cards to her chest re: her shar worship)

BriefInRoom_154.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_154.text: Only a fool would doubt it.

BriefInRoom_211.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_211.text: Very nice of you, but I've been to Moonrise Towers already.

BriefInRoom_253.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_253.text: You... have. Forgive me for gilding the lily. I suppose if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing into the night, there's work to be done there yet.

BriefInRoom_185.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_185.text: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.

BriefInRoom_4.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_4.text: Well! If I'd have realised, I'd have spared the theatrics. In that case, you should be able to navigate a path straight to your target. That's good - very good.

BriefInRoom_13.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_13.text: I wish you luck. The very best of it.

BriefInRoom_45.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_45.text: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.

BriefInRoom_275.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_275.text: A Moonlantern? Those are powered by trapped pixies, you know.

BriefInRoom_114.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_114.text: We'll be sure to free them - after Ketheric is dead.

BriefInRoom_163.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_163.text: Thank you - now I must take my leave.

BriefInRoom_98.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_98.text: Good luck, and may the Moonmaiden protect you.
BriefInRoom_98.context: NodeContext: The 'if you can stand it' version is for a Sharran player

BriefInRoom_25.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_25.text: While you're busy in the Towers, I'll be sure to - Marcus? What's wrong?
BriefInRoom_25.context: NodeContext: Sees Marcus approaching and startles somewhat.

BriefInRoom_167.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_167.text: While you're busy in the Towers, I'll be sure to - wait. Do you hear that? Something's wrong...
BriefInRoom_167.context: NodeContext: Hears Marcus about to burst through the ceiling.

BriefInRoom_36.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_36.text: While you're busy in the Towers, I'll keep the people here safe. If you find a way in, we'll come to your aid. Until then: go well. Be safe. And if you should meet Ketheric Thorm... be careful.

BriefInRoom_196.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_196.text: The Moonmaiden's protection is most welcome - thank you for this boon.

BriefInRoom_115.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_115.text: I'm sure your god already grants you a great deal - but a little extra never hurt.

BriefInRoom_6.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_6.text: Let us hope Selûne's protection is worth the sickly radiance.

BriefInRoom_158.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_158.text: I don't think you can afford to be picky - no matter how distasteful your god finds mine.

BriefInRoom_223.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_223.text: Selûne's divinity is... strange to me, but her aid is welcome.

BriefInRoom_96.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_96.text: Well, we live in strange times.

BriefInRoom_187.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_187.text: Anything else I should know before heading off?

BriefInRoom_264.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_264.text: Ketheric is a frightening man. But you have something he doesn't: allies worth having.

BriefInRoom_213.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_213.text: You must know this curse well to offer this blessing - can you tell me any more about its unnatural source?

BriefInRoom_33.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_33.text: I... No. I cannot. I simply impart the blessings the Moonmaiden provides me.
BriefInRoom_33.context: NodeContext: stammer - slightly nervous, changing topic quickly

BriefInRoom_169.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_169.text: Hold on - Marcus is a True Soul. He's here to kidnap you.

BriefInRoom_69.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_69.text: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

BriefInRoom_22.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_22.context: NodeContext: Eye roll/ sarcastic. Player just otld her Marcus is a True Soul and at first she doesn't believe them.

BriefInRoom_153.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_153.context: NodeContext: Coming around to reality, suddenly very suspciious. Marcus is about ot pounce.

BriefInRoom_199.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_199.text: I may have the parasite of a True Soul, but not the mind of one.

BriefInRoom_194.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_194.text: I know your name, but little else. Care to enlighten me?

BriefInRoom_137.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_137.text: I'm a cleric of Our Lady of Silver - the moon goddess Selûne.

BriefInRoom_28.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_28.text: As long as I keep channelling her power, this inn stays un-cursed. A defence to your offence.
BriefInRoom_28.context: NodeContext: OFF-ence, not offence like offensive

BriefInRoom_27.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_27.text: I already exposed the traitor among your ranks - what more do you want?

BriefInRoom_151.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_151.text: And I'm very grateful. But very needy, too.

BriefInRoom_77.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_77.text: Imagine our luck. We set up a desperate camp in the middle of a curse, in the heart of an evil cult - and who should emerge from the darkness but you.

BriefInRoom_67.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_67.text: I must say, it was incredible to see the Moonmaiden working through you.

BriefInRoom_78.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_78.text: Needed here more than anywhere. This place is thick with Shar's curse. Can't be easy for our Lady to penetrate, but she finds a way.

BriefInRoom_62.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_62.text: How have you made this sanctuary in the dark?

BriefInRoom_159.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_159.text: Our Lady has granted me the ability to protect these people. It isn't a permanent fix, but it's what we've got.

BriefInRoom_101.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_101.text: Speaking of - you must be here for the protection spell - yes?

BriefInRoom_9.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_9.text: You must be a high cleric indeed to enjoy such direct blessings from our Lady.

BriefInRoom_40.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_40.text: Not so much high as... necessary, perhaps.
BriefInRoom_40.context: NodeContext: A slight scoff of derision

BriefInRoom_244.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_244.text: Are you faring all right? It can't be easy holding a lone candle in such darkness.

BriefInRoom_55.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_55.text: All things with her strength. You know the litany.
BriefInRoom_55.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastically. She's got a bone to pick with Selune but isn't being too overt.

BriefInRoom_29.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_29.text: All things in her strength. That's how the old litany goes, after all.
BriefInRoom_29.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastically. She's got a bone to pick with Selune but isn't being too overt.

BriefInRoom_71.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_71.text: To see another so in touch with divinity is rare. You have my thanks, Selûnite.

BriefInRoom_289.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_289.text: And you mine - not many comprehend the task of steadfast faith.

BriefInRoom_150.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_150.text: Oh, joy. The True Soul turned out to be a baddie after all.
BriefInRoom_150.context: NodeContext: Feigned boredom, real anger. If the player tries to kidnap her.

BriefInRoom_188.speaker: Player
BriefInRoom_188.text: I want nothing more than to cut you up and eat you raw!

BriefInRoom_287.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_287.text: The True Soul who's going to save us all. I'm Isobel. Pleased to meet you.
BriefInRoom_287.context: NodeContext: With a twinkle in her eye and a bit of swagger despite the fact htat she's just come off a coughing fit.

BriefInRoom_0.speaker: Isobel
BriefInRoom_0.text: And a Sharran one at that.
